reviews.review_msg: The lectures are long, boring, and usually leaves you confused. Her tone is monotonous when she reads off her script and slides aren't really easy to understand unless you've done the readings. She speaks with unnecessarily complex language and so does the readings she chooses, so it's easy to get confused no matter how much she explains concepts.

Her seminars are very monotone and hard to follow because she reads her script, which uses difficult language to explain new concepts. So she is really not a great presenter and it took me some time to get a hang of the concepts. She does try to make it engaging with in-class activities, student presentations, and encouraging critical thinking.

Very knowledgeable and brought real world, local examples to apply the theory to. Great experience in her class: understands there is life outside the SFU bubble and really prepares you for working after post-secondary

Darcie is an amazing professor and by far the best professor I have had to date at SFU. She let us do anything we wanted for the final project instead of a paper! We were allowed to be creative and classes were fun and interesting. It did not even feel like a 4 hour lecture because of all the interesting discussion topics, videos and questions.

An awesome prof. All of the reviews here are from SA150 so I just wanted to give perspective as a student of an UD course he teaches. He is passionate about sociology and student success. He can be intimidating, but he means well and is not as rude as he comes across lol. Best class I've ever taken at SFU. Approach him for an insightful convo!

Kyle is one of the most charismatic and knowledgeable professors in the entire department. He goes above and beyond to help students in class and in his office. Lectures are fun and engaging even when they go on for 4 hours straight. Take any classes he offers, they will all be super interesting
Love Kyle, great instructor great lecturer, super funny and really nice
Kyle was a great prof, if a little nervous. Great readings!

If you're looking for a knowledgable, caring, and charismatic professor who does his best to keep lectures relevant and engaging, Kyle is your guy. Prepare for lots of laughs at his witty remarks and meme obsession. While this class was my favourite, it doesn't mean it was easy. The paper, and two exams require an understanding of course concepts.

Kyle is such an awesome instructor. The material can be dry and heavy at times but the analytical tools you develop by being in his class will improve your entire academic career. Make sure to attend every lecture and attend as many office hours as you can. That is the best way to do well in this is course!

Benita is great. very important and informative lectures. I learned a lot from her and she became an inspirational figure for me. she asks for a good share of work but it al makes you more engaged in the subjects. recommend this course! Benita goes extra miles to help and engage students. She loves to spend time with her students and truly helps!

Benita's class is not easy, but she will challenge you to work harder and think differently.  You may not always agree with her ideas, but it is worth it to keep an open mind;  this is one class that really made me think, and one that I really learned and grew from. Take her class if you actually care about learning, and not just about the grade.

Benita is one of the best of not the best prof I've had in the four years of my undergrad. She challenges you and supports you (don't expects you to do the work and won't spoon feed you). I have the utmost respect for her and am extremely grateful to have taken this class

DEFINITELY take a class with Dany!! This is by far my favourite class I've taken at Sfu. Her classes are heavily based on group discussions of readings and group work, so if you don't like speaking out in class don't take this class. I loved her because she really wanted her students to do well

Dany is really enthusiastic about social control and really wants all of the students to participate and get involved. Her exams are very open ended; she wants you to do well and not have much stress, however, she's a hard marker!

Dr. Macdonald chose very interesting subjects for the class lectures but unfortunately the midterm only concerned the course readings, which I found challenging to get through at times. I did not enjoy the group project very much, and they were selected by alphabetical order so you have no control when you present or who you present with.

I think the score here is a bit misleading. Yes, the grading is hard and exams can be artificially difficult, but she provides readings that are really useful and important, and she is willing to put in extra work for herself to see students succeed (as long as they show they want to put in the work on their end).
